definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: Actually, both means of recording possess their respective advantages which are beneficial to us.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，兩種記錄方式各有千秋。

sentences.english: For this kind of bookbinding methods, is a great deal.
sentences.chinese: 對於這一類的圖書裝訂方法有很多種，各有千秋。

sentences.english: The world cultural heritages of Europe spread all over the place and have their characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲世界文化遺產星羅棋佈，各有千秋。

sentences.english: Both of these solutions have their merits, but I am more partial to the later.
sentences.chinese: 這兩種方式各有千秋，不過我更偏愛後者。

sentences.english: The two theories vary, but they are compassable.
sentences.chinese: 這兩種理論各有千秋，但它們是並行不悖的。

sentences.english: Chinese drawing and European painting have their own advantages and inherit their own culture.
sentences.chinese: 中國畫和歐洲油畫各有千秋，承載着各自的文化。

sentences.english: These three techniques of enamel have their own advantages and learn from each other.
sentences.chinese: 這三種琺琅工藝相互借鑑，各有千秋。

sentences.english: In the United States, the most successful entrepreneurs look different.
sentences.chinese: 在美國，最成功的創業者各有千秋。

definition: lit. unable to distinguish eldest brother from second brother (idiom); they are all equally excellent/nothing to choose between them
virtually the same/differing only on small points
to have nothing in common with each other (idiom)
everyone has their likes and dislikes (idiom)
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
as different as can be (idiom)/poles apart
